channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge Says Habba Has Served as U.S. Attorney Without Legal Authority
item.description: Defense lawyers had questioned whether Alina Habba, a Trump loyalist, was legally authorized to run the U.S. attorney’s office in New Jersey.

item.title: With Fed under pressure, Jerome Powell prepares for a high-stakes speech
item.description: The Fed chair will speak Friday at an annual economic symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyo. The speech comes as the central bank is under mounting pressure ...

item.title: Trump’s Attacks on Fed Overshadow a Critical Moment for the Central Bank
item.description: The president’s calls for Lisa Cook, a Fed governor, to resign are diverting attention from economic issues as top central bankers from around the wor...

item.title: Ingrid Lewis-Martin, Top Adams Adviser, Faces Fresh Corruption Charges
item.description: Ms. Lewis-Martin, the former chief adviser to Mayor Eric Adams, is accused of taking bribes in exchange for favorable treatment, including speeding ci...

item.title: Trump says he's going on patrol in DC with the National Guard
item.description: President Trump says he wants to see for himself how National Guard soldiers and police officers are cracking down on what he has described as rampant...

item.title: Artificial light has essentially lengthened birds' day
item.description: Millions of audio recordings of hundreds of bird species have revealed that artificial light is making the birds wake up earlier and go to bed later.

item.title: Israel Is Expanding Its Gaza City Operation, but Where Does It Stand?
item.description: The Israeli government is widening its operation in Gaza despite its generals’ advice and as it deliberates on a new cease-fire proposal.

item.title: Texas and California near new partisan voting maps in a battle prompted by Trump
item.description: California and Texas, the country's two most populous states, are getting closer to redrawing their congressional districts in a political fight spark...

item.title: Hurricane Erin Is Heading Out to Sea. People Are Riveted Anyway.
item.description: The Category 2 hurricane isn’t expected to make landfall. Still, it’s drawing notice as the first named storm to reach hurricane strength this year.

item.title: Hamas has one top strategy: End the war and survive
item.description: Hamas has endorsed a new proposal for a ceasefire deal with Israel in Gaza, as it faces pressure from Arab countries and seeks to ensure its own survi...

item.title: Vance Recounts Telling Zelensky to ‘Behave’ in Trump Meeting
item.description: It was not the first time that the vice president had addressed Ukraine’s leader with words more commonly spoken to toddlers than heads of state.

item.title: Israel Is Expanding Its Gaza City Operation, but Where Does It Stand?
item.description: The Israeli government is widening its operation in Gaza despite its generals’ advice and as it deliberates on a new cease-fire proposal.

item.title: Anxiety Mounts in Gaza City as Israel Threatens a New Offensive
item.description: The Israeli military announced that it’s preparing to take control of Gaza City, where many displaced Palestinians have taken refuge.

item.title: French Authorities Investigate Death of Streamer Jean Pormanove After Months of Abuse
item.description: Raphaël Graven, known online as Jean Pormanove, was regularly subjected to humiliation and abuse on Kick, a streaming platform.

item.title: Europe Gets a Written Trump Trade Deal, With a Caveat for Automakers
item.description: Under the newly fleshed-out details, Washington will maintain high tariffs on vehicles imported from the bloc until the E.U. takes steps to lower its ...
